🚀 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐃𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐀𝐖𝐒 𝐄𝐅𝐒 & 𝐒𝟑: 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐞 & 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬! 📂🔒Cloud storage is more than just saving files—it's about 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆, 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 across multiple instances. In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! Excited to explore more in this journey. 🚀Looking to connect with professionals and recruiters in 𝗔𝗪𝗦, 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗗𝗲𝘃𝗢𝗽𝘀? In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

🚀 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐃𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐀𝐖𝐒 𝐄𝐅𝐒 & 𝐒𝟑: 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐞 & 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬! 📂🔒Cloud storage is more than just saving files—it's about 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆, 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 across multiple instances. In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

🚀 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐃𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐀𝐖𝐒 𝐄𝐅𝐒 & 𝐒𝟑: 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐞 & 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬! 📂🔒Cloud storage is more than just saving files—it's about 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆, 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 across multiple instances. In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

🚀 Mastering Jenkins: The Key to CI/CD Success!In today's fast-paced development world, automation is no longer a luxury—it's a necessity! Jenkins is one of the most powerful CI/CD tools that helps teams streamline their software development process, ensuring faster deployments with higher reliability.🔹 What is Jenkins? Jenkins is an open-source automation server that helps developers build, test, and deploy applications efficiently. It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Jenkins is one of the most powerful CI/CD tools that helps teams streamline their software development process, ensuring faster deployments with higher reliability.🔹 What is Jenkins? Jenkins is an open-source automation server that helps developers build, test, and deploy applications efficiently. It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Jenkins is one of the most powerful CI/CD tools that helps teams streamline their software development process, ensuring faster deployments with higher reliability.🔹 What is Jenkins? Jenkins is an open-source automation server that helps developers build, test, and deploy applications efficiently. It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Jenkins is one of the most powerful CI/CD tools that helps teams streamline their software development process, ensuring faster deployments with higher reliability.🔹 What is Jenkins? Jenkins is an open-source automation server that helps developers build, test, and deploy applications efficiently. It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁! I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

💡 Can a custom-built Redis-like system optimize memory and handle high-throughput workloads efficiently? Let’s push the limits! 🚀 🚀 Building Smarter Caching: Redis Clone with LRU Eviction! 🔥As part of my 100-Day Tech Mastery Challenge, I’ve implemented Least Recently Used (LRU) Caching in my Redis clone to intelligently manage memory while handling millions of requests per second! Watch the demo in action! 🎥👇🔹 New Features Implemented:✅ LRU Eviction – Automatically removes least-used keys to free up memory 🧠 ✅ Optimized Memory Management – Balancing speed & storage for efficient caching ⚡ ✅ Customizable Cache Size – Dynamically control cache limits for real-world scalability🔜 Next Milestones:🔹 Clustering & Replication – Scaling for high availability 🌎 🔹 Persistence Optimization (AOF & RDB) – Fine-tuning for durability 🔄 🔹 Performance Tuning – Breaking speed barriers 🚀📸 Watch the Video & See It in Action! 🎥 (👇Attached)💡 Why This Matters?✅ Mastering System Design for high-performance applications ✅ Optimizing caching for low-latency, high-throughput workloads ✅ Sharing My Journey 🚀 hashtag#BuildInPublic to learn & grow with the tech communityHuge shoutout to Salvatore Sanfilippo, Alex Xu, Hussein Nasser, Kunal Kushwaha, the Redis Community, Santiago Moneta, Gergely Orosz, Sid Sijbrandij, Charity Majors, SWYX SOLUTIONS UK LIMITED,  Lalitha V. Deshpande, Abhishek Singh, MAYANK GAUR for their incredible insights on distributed systems & caching! 🚀💬 Let’s Discuss! 📌 How do you handle cache eviction in large-scale systems? 📌 Have you ever built or optimized an in-memory storage system? I am still hiring!  We need an experienced modern C++ developer than groks low-latency, efficient code construction, and greenfield engineering practices.  We need a QA to partner with our existing QAs.  And we need a DevOps to work alongside our fantastic DevOps engineer.  That is 3 people right there for the US.Moreover, I will soon have 2 new US job requisitions open.  Both will be very challenging positions to fill, with very stringent requirements.  These two new reqs will be for a Sr Engineer and a Sr QA.  Here are the particulars for the Sr Engr:. Well versed in modern C++17/20 and current Boost libraries. Experienced with massive parallelism, such as DPDK, SPDK, HPX, OpenMP. Experienced with low-latency architectures and coding practices. At least 10 years of hands-on experience in C++ low-latency development, 15+ years overall. Works well with other very smart people, enjoys the zero->one creation process. Works well remotely, with minimal supervision, but outstanding resultsThe Sr QA is going to be challenge to find, IMHO.  Prove me wrong!. Understands modern C++ 17/20 - can read PRs, talk with developers. Java 17 experience, can run testcases in Java, compare to C++ results. Can work with Java coredumps easily. Understands sequential consistency, has working in large parallel environments. Has worked with software the decomposes a larger work into smaller tasks. Has a passion for correctness. Can script in python on Linux, well versed in using Linux command line tools. Loves to automated testing, regression testing. Working in a greenfield environment (not well specified, think start-up). Will to go deep in understanding how the code worksAll of these positions are pivotal for what we are developing here at FICO.  The bar is high, because your teammates are also exceptionally strong programmers.FICO is an excellent company to work for.  We are fully remote, with exceptional management (my boss Tom Traughber, and teammate Sachin Kulkarni).  My teams are creating the future platform for FICO.  It is truly greenfield, and we are fairly far along in the process, closing in on a beta release.The entry criteria for these 2 new positions (not yet posted), are very strict.  You will be working on pivotal software, which very high expectations of throughput, low latency, and 100% fidelity.  I mention this now because I need to get ahead of the curve!  If you are interested, please ping me.  We are creating the future here at FICO, alongside our existing top-of-the-market solutions.  Your teammates are looking forward to your arrival and successes!

Jenkins is one of the most powerful CI/CD tools that helps teams streamline their software development process, ensuring faster deployments with higher reliability.🔹 What is Jenkins? Jenkins is an open-source automation server that helps developers build, test, and deploy applications efficiently. It integrates with hundreds of tools, making it the go-to choice for DevOps teams worldwide.🔹 Why Jenkins? ✅ Automates the build & deployment process ✅ Supports multiple plugins & integrations (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Git, etc.) ✅ Enhances collaboration between Dev & Ops teams ✅ Improves code quality through automated testing🔹 Jenkins in Action With Jenkins, you can set up pipelines that automate everything—from pulling code from a repository to deploying it on cloud servers. Whether you're running Docker containers, Kubernetes clusters, or serverless functions, Jenkins has you covered!

💡 Can a custom-built Redis-like system optimize memory and handle high-throughput workloads efficiently? Let’s push the limits! 🚀 🚀 Building Smarter Caching: Redis Clone with LRU Eviction! 🔥As part of my 100-Day Tech Mastery Challenge, I’ve implemented Least Recently Used (LRU) Caching in my Redis clone to intelligently manage memory while handling millions of requests per second! Watch the demo in action! 🎥👇🔹 New Features Implemented:✅ LRU Eviction – Automatically removes least-used keys to free up memory 🧠 ✅ Optimized Memory Management – Balancing speed & storage for efficient caching ⚡ ✅ Customizable Cache Size – Dynamically control cache limits for real-world scalability🔜 Next Milestones:🔹 Clustering & Replication – Scaling for high availability 🌎 🔹 Persistence Optimization (AOF & RDB) – Fine-tuning for durability 🔄 🔹 Performance Tuning – Breaking speed barriers 🚀📸 Watch the Video & See It in Action! 🎥 (👇Attached)💡 Why This Matters?✅ Mastering System Design for high-performance applications ✅ Optimizing caching for low-latency, high-throughput workloads ✅ Sharing My Journey 🚀 hashtag#BuildInPublic to learn & grow with the tech communityHuge shoutout to Salvatore Sanfilippo, Alex Xu, Hussein Nasser, Kunal Kushwaha, the Redis Community, Santiago Moneta, Gergely Orosz, Sid Sijbrandij, Charity Majors, SWYX SOLUTIONS UK LIMITED,  Lalitha V. Deshpande, Abhishek Singh, MAYANK GAUR for their incredible insights on distributed systems & caching! 🚀💬 Let’s Discuss! 📌 How do you handle cache eviction in large-scale systems? 📌 Have you ever built or optimized an in-memory storage system? Share your insights!Drop a comment—I’d love to hear your thoughts! 👇📍 Follow me for daily updates as I refine & scale my Redis project! 🚀 🔗 GitHub: https://lnkd.in/dC64cv8p 🔗 Video Tweet Deployed Link: https://lnkd.in/dTAKdVDE 🔗 Code360: https://lnkd.in/duXgGtUthashtag#Redis hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#SystemDesign hashtag#SoftwareEngineering hashtag#Scalability hashtag#Microservices hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Caching hashtag#DistributedSystems hashtag#HighPerformance hashtag#BuildInPublic hashtag#Hiring 🚀

🚀 𝐃𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐃𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐀𝐖𝐒 𝐄𝐅𝐒 & 𝐒𝟑: 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐞 & 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐒𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬! 📂🔒Cloud storage is more than just saving files—it's about 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆, 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 across multiple instances. In my latest AWS learning session, I explored 𝗘𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲 𝗦𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 (𝗘𝗙𝗦) & 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯, diving deeper into their configurations, security, and real-world applications.𝑲𝒆𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒂𝒘𝒂𝒚𝒔 𝒇𝒓𝒐𝒎 𝑻𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚’𝒔 𝑺𝒆𝒔𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏:✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗘𝗙𝗦 – 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 & 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 🔹 𝗕𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲: Understanding how EFS dynamically scales to meet workload demands. 🔹 𝗠𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 & 𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶-𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀: Configuring EFS to connect multiple EC2 instances seamlessly. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀 & 𝗔𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹:--> Editing security groups for EC2 instances.--> Setting up 𝗶𝗻𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 & 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗯𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 rules to control traffic securely.--> Enabling 𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀-𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗘𝗙𝗦 access while maintaining security best practices.✅ 𝗔𝗺𝗮𝘇𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝟯 – 𝗢𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 🔹 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝟯: A cost-effective, scalable storage solution for data backup, analytics, and content distribution. 🔹 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝘂𝗰𝗸𝗲𝘁𝘀: Hands-on experience in setting up S3 buckets. 🔹 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 & 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗙𝗶𝗹𝗲𝘀: Learning best practices for organizing data in S3.𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑻𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝑴𝒂𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒔?🔹 𝗘𝗙𝗦 𝗶𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 in cloud-native applications & microservices. 🔹 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ensure data integrity and controlled access. 🔹 𝗦𝟯 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗮𝗰𝗸𝗯𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲, used for backups, static websites, big data, and more.Mastering 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 is a key step toward becoming a 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁!
